SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'This is further to our press release dated May 10, 2019, titled ￂﾓFeedback from European Commission on the proposed steel joint venture between thyssenkrupp and Tata Steel in Europeￂﾔ.The European Commission on June 11, 2019, formally announced its decision to prohibit the proposed European steel joint venture between Tata Steel Limited and thyssenkrupp AG. Both companies, in statements on May 10, 2019, anticipated that the European Commission would not clear the proposed joint venture despite both parties offering a comprehensive package of remedies addressing the concerns of the Commission. Tata Steel noted with deep disappointment the conclusions of the Commission. The Company remains committed to its long-term strategy of focusing on growth in India, continue deleveraging its Balance Sheet and working towards creating a sustainable portfolio in Europe.This disclosure is being made in compliance with Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015.'.

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: TATASTEEL: The Exchange had sought clarification from the Company with respect to news item captioned - titled "Tata Steel s Rs 805 crore bid for Bhushan Energy gets nod". In this regard, it was advised to provide clarification/confirmation on the news item in detail including the following: a) Whether such event stated in published news were taking place? If so, it was advised to provide the said information along with the sequence of events in chronological order. b) The material impact of this article on the Company. c) Whether company was aware of any information that has not been announced to the Exchanges under Regulation 30 of Listing Regulations. If so, it was advised to provide the said information and the reasons for not disclosing the same to the Exchange earlier as required under Regulation 30 of the Listing Regulations. The response received from the Company is attached.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange regarding  Board meeting held on May 16, 2018. Please find enclosed the business transacted at the Board Meeting.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange regarding Outcome of Board Meeting held on May 16, 2018.This has reference to our letter dated May 8, 2018.The Board of Directors at the meeting held today, i.e. May 16, 2018, inter alia, transacted the following business:1. Financial Resultsa) Approved the Audited Standalone and Unaudited Consolidated Financial Results of the Company for the quarter ended March 31, 2018.b) Approved the Audited Standalone and Consolidated Financial Results of the Company for the financial year ended March 31, 2018.Price Waterhouse & Co Chartered Accountants LLP, the Statutory Auditors of the Company have issued auditorsￂﾒ reports with an unmodified opinion on the financial statements.2. Dividend and 111th Annual General Meeting (AGM)Recommended a dividend of Rs. 10/-  per Ordinary Share of Rs. 10 each and Rs. 2.504 per partly paid Ordinary Share of Rs. 10/- each (paid-up Rs. 2.504 per share) to the shareholders for the financial year ended March 31, 2018. The dividend recommended by the Board is subject to the approval of the shareholders at the ensuing Annual General Meeting (AGM) of the Company to be held on Friday, July 20, 2018.The dividend, if approved by the shareholders at the AGM, will be paid on and from July 23, 2018. 3. Book ClosureApproved closure of the Register of Members and Share Transfer Books of the Company from Saturday, July 7, 2018 to Friday, July 20, 2018 (both days inclusive) for the purpose of AGM and payment of Dividend.The Board meeting commenced at 2:00 p.m. (IST) and concluded at 5:55 p.m. (IST).        A copy of the said results together with the Auditorsￂﾒ Report and Press Release is enclosed herewith. These are also being made available on the website of the Company at www.tatasteel.com.This is for your information and record.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors at the meeting held April 20, 2017 has reviewed the performance, capital structure and financing plan of the Company. Based on the review and pursuant to the existing shareholders approval, the Board approved issue of debt securities of up to Rs. 9,000 crore in the form either of Non-Convertible Debentures on private placement basis or Foreign Currency or Rupee Denominated Bonds or a combination thereof in one or more tranches. The funds will primarily be deployed towards re-financing the existing debt, capex/working capital requirements and general corporate purposes. The Board of Directors also authorized the Finance Committee of the Board to determine and approve the timing and terms of such issue of securities.

DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that Mr. Cyrus P. Mistry, Member of the Board of Directors (Board) of Tata Steel Limited has stepped down from the Board with immediate effect.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange vide letter dated December 17, 2016 "This has reference to our disclosure dated December 15, 2016 informing the exchange of the Company being served with a copy of the plaint in Suit No (L) 1119 of 2016 filed by Mr. Janak Mathuradas & Ors against Union of India & Ors (Tata Steel Limited being Defendant No 6) along with copy of the Notice of Motion for ad-interim relief sought therein and with a copy of the affidavit in support of the notice of motion. The Notice of Motion was on board for ad-interim reliefs before His Lordship, the Hon'ble Mr. Justice S.J. Kathawalla on December 16, 2016. The Hon ble Court ordered that the resolution passed at the ensuing EGM with regard to the removal of Mr. Nusli Wadia as a Director of the Company, shall be subject to the orders passed by the Court at the interim stage. Also, until further orders, one seat among the Directors permissible under the Articles of Association of the Company will remain unfilled".

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange had sought clarification from the Company with respect to recent news item captioned Minority Shareholders move Bombay HC against Nusli Wadia s removal. The response from the Company is attached.

The Notice of Motion will be on board for ad-interim reliefs before His Lordship, the Hon'ble Mr. Justice S.J. Kathawalla on December 16, 2016.

The response from the Company is awaited.

In terms of Section 169(4) of the Companies Act, 2013, Mr. Cyrus P. Mistry has forwarded his representation to the Company and has requested that the same be circulated to all the Members of the Company. SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at the meeting held on November 11, 2016 took note of the leadership changes at Tata Sons Limited as well as the Special Notice & Requisition received from Tata Sons Limited (Promoter and Principal Shareholder) to convene an Extra Ordinary General Meeting (EGM) and place a resolution, inter alia, for the removal of Mr. Cyrus P. Mistry as a Director of the Company. In view of the current situation i.e. the above Special Notice & Requisition received from Tata Sons Limited, the Board of Directors through circular resolutions dated November 25, 2016 passed by majority consent, has decided to replace Mr. Cyrus P. Mistry as the Chairman of the Board with immediate effect and have elected Mr. O. P. Bhatt, an Independent Director as the Chairman of the Board.

Tata Steel Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "that Tata Steel UK Limited  ("TSUK" - indirect subsidiary of Tata Steel Limited)  has learnt of the strike from the press statement issued by the Unions.  TSUK has not received any formal notice from the Unions with respect to the said strike. TSUK will issue appropriate statements upon receiving formal notice. Accordingly the Company (Tata Steel Limited) will make necessary disclosures to the exchanges and investors at the appropriate time."

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that with reference to the earlier announcement dated April 10, 2013 regarding amalgamation of Kalimati with the Company under the Scheme of Amalgamation pursuant to Sections 391-394 of the Companies Act, 1956, Tata Steel Ltd has now informed the Exchange that " Since then, the Company has taken various steps to complete the amalgamation of Kalimati with the Company. Currently, the Scheme of Amalgamation is pending for final hearing before the Bombay High Court.Clause 15.C of the Scheme of Amalgamation reads as under: "In the event of this Scheme failing to take effect by March 31, 2014 or such later date as may be agreed by the respective Boards of Directors of the Transferor Company and the Transferee Company, this Scheme shall stand revoked, cancelled and be of no effect and become null and void, and in that event, no rights and liabilities shall accrue to or be incurred inter se between the parties or their shareholders or creditors or employees or any other person. In such case, each of the Transferor Company and the Transferee Company shall bear its own costs and expenses or as may be otherwise mutually agreed." Pursuant to the aforesaid clause, the Board of Directors of the Company and Kalimati have at their respective board meetings held on March 10, 2014, passed the resolutions extending the long-stop date of the Scheme by one year, i.e. from March 31, 2014 to March 31, 2015."

SUBJECT: Follow-on public issue
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that, with respect to the proposed Follow-on public offer (FPO) of equity shares of Rs. 10 each (the "Equity Shares") of Tata Steel Ltd (the "Company") (the "Issue"), a Committee of Directors duly authorized by the Board of Directors of the Company by a resolution dated January 14, 2011, has fixed the price band at Rs.594 to Rs.610 per Equity Share. The Bid opens on January 19, 2011 and closes on January 21, 2011. The anchor book opens and closes on January 18, 2011. The minimum bid lot will be 10 equity shares of Rs. 10 each.

SUBJECT: Follow-on public issue
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the Committee of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on January 11, 2011 approved a Further Public Issue of 57 million Ordinary Shares of Rs. 10 each of the Company for such price as may be determined through the book-building process under the SEBI (Issue of Capital and Disclosure Requirements), Regulations, 2009, as amended ("SEBI Regulations"). This includes a reservation for eligible employees for 1.5 million Ordinary Shares of Rs. 10 each (the "Issue"). The price band and the minimum bid lot for the issue will be decided by the Company in consultation with the book running lead managers and will be advertised at least one working day prior to the bid/Issue opening date. The issue will open after completion of all necessary regulatory requirements.

SUBJECT: Notice of Postal Ballot
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that pursuant to Section 192A(2) of the Companies Act, 1956, read with the Companies (Passing of the Resolution by Postal Ballot) Rules, 2001, the resolutions appended below are proposed to be passed as Ordinary/Special Resolutions as the case may be by way of Postal Ballot : (1) Ordinary Resolution for increase in the Authorised Share Capital of the Company from Rs.8000,00,00,000 (Rupees Eight Thousand Crores) to Rs.8350,00,00,000 (Rupees Eight Thousand Three Hundred Fifty Crores) by creation of 35,00,00,000 (Thirty-five Thousand Crores) 'A' Ordinary Shares of Rs.10 (Ten) each; (2) Special Resolution for alternation of the Memorandum and Articles of Association of the Company for increase in the Authorised Share Capital (as above) and for incorporation of provisions relating to 'A' Ordinary Shares; (3) Special Resolution for raising of additional long term resources not exceeding Rs.7000,00,00,000 (Rupees Seven Thousand Crores).

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors at its meeting held on November 12, 2010 has decided to seek the approval of the shareholders of the Company by means of postal ballot for the following : (a) Raising of additional long term resources through issue of securities, including ordinary shares, equity shares with differential rights as to voting and dividend, GDRs, debentures, foreign currency bonds, etc. up to Rs.7,000 Crores; and (b) Alteration of Memorandum and Articles of Association for increase in the Authorized Capital of the Company from Rs.8,000 Crores to Rs.8350 Crores.

SUBJECT: Scheme of Amalgamation
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange with reference to Scheme of Amalgamation of wholly owned subsidiary Hooghly Met Coke & Power Company Ltd (HMPCL) with Tata Steel Ltd, that HMPCL being a wholly owned subsidiary of Tata Steel Ltd, on Company's application, High Court of Judicature at Bombay, vide its order dated September 11, 2009 dispensed with the filing of further Petition and following any other procedure. Further the Company has informed that the petition filed by HMPCL in the Hon. High Court at Calcutta, has been approved on February 16, 2010 and the Scheme of Amalgamation has been sanctioned with effect from the Appointed Date i.e. April 01, 2009. Further the Company confirms that they have filed the Orders approving the Scheme of Amalgamation with the Registrar of Companies, Maharashtra, Mumbai, on March 25, 2010. As per the Scheme of Amalgamation, HMPCL being wholly owned subsidiary of Tata Steel, all the shares held by Tata Steel will be cancelled.

SUBJECT: Press Release/Others
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange vide its letter dated July 29, 2009 that "The Board of Directors of the Company and Hooghly Met Coke & Power Company Limited (HMPCL) have at their respective meetings held today approved of a Scheme of Amalgamation of HMPCL with the Company with effect from April 1, 2009. HMPCL is a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company with its registered office in West Bengal. Upon the Scheme coming into effect and in terms of the Scheme of amalgamation, all assets and liabilities of HMPCL will stand transferred to the Company at their book values and all shares of HMPCL shall stand cancelled. No shares will be issued by the Company in lieu of shares of HMPCL. The Scheme is subject to and conditional upon requisite approvals and sanctions being received thereof, including approvals and orders under Sections 391 and 394 of the Companies Act, 1956, as may be required. SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange vide its letter dated October 15, 2008 that "In view of speculative and uninformed reports in certain sections of the media today on the state of the Corus Pension Funds, Tata Steel Group wishes to clarify that the Pension Funds of Corus were in aggregate surplus of GBP 500 million (USD 1bn) as on June 30, 2008. The UK Pension Funds of Corus are significantly de-risked with around 70% of the portfolio in debt related instruments. Based on initial quarter end assessment, the surplus as on September 30, 2008 is estimated to be higher than end June 2008. The details of the Pension Funds performance would be disclosed at the time of the publication of the consolidated financial results of the Company in November 2008".

SUBJECT: AGM Rescheduled
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited had informed the Exchange that the Annual General Meeting (AGM) will be held on July 18, 2007. The Company has now informed the Exchange that: "Arising from a combination of factors, including a delay in receiving approval from the Government of India exempting the Company from attaching the accounts of its subsidiaries in the Annual Accounts and the inclusion of substantial additional information because of the Centenary Year of the Company, there was a delay in the printing and despatch of the 2007 Annual Report to the shareholders. Consequently, it is possible that many shareholders may not have received the Notice convening the AGM on 18th July 2007 together with the Annual Report for the year ended 31st March, 2007, as per the time limit prescribed by the Companies Act, 1956. Accordingly in the best interest of the shareholders, the Board of Directors has rescheduled the AGM on Wednesday, 29th August 2007 at 3.30 p.m. at Birla Matushri Sabhagar, Mumbai".

SUBJECT: Memorandum of Understanding
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that "The Company, today (i.e. 29th May, 2007) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Vietnam Steel Corporation (VSC) for the proposed steel project in Ha Tinh province in Vietnam. The Company has a Joint Venture with VSC through NatSteel which is a Singapore based subsidiary of the Company. The Company is further strengthening this relationship by partnering with VSC in establishing a steel project in the Ha Tinh province. Vietnam with a buoyant economy, significant market and raw material is an attractive destination for steel making. The plant is proposed to have an estimated capacity of 4.5 Million tons per annum which will be phased over ten 10 years. The scope and the investment will be estimated after the feasibility studies. The Company will have a minimum stake of 65% in the Steel project, which will be initiated on the successful completion of feasibility study and financial closure. Moreover, the Company will also have a stake of 30% in the Thach Khe Iron Ore Joint Stock Company which would undertake mining in the Thach Khe iron ore mine".

The induction of the above mentioned four Corus' directors on the Board of the Company will bring in a rich and varied experience that would enable it to manage the business of the enlarged size and complexity".

SUBJECT: Release
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that: "At a hearing held on 27th March 2007, the High Court of Justice in England and Wales passed an order sanctioning the Scheme of Arrangement (the "Scheme") relating to the recommended offer for acquisition of Cours Group Plc, by the Company through its wholly owned indirect subsidiary, Tata Steel UK Limited, at a price of 608 pence per ordinary share in cash. This follows approval of the Scheme, by the requisite majorities of Corus shareholders, at the Court Meeting and the Extraordinary General Meeting, which were held on 7 March 2007. The expected timetable of the remaining principal events required to implement the Scheme is as follows: 29 March 2007 - Dealings in Corus Shares suspended on the London Stock Exchange and the Amsterdam Stock Exchange and dealings in Corus ADSs suspended on the New York Stock Exchange. 30 March 2007 - Court hearing to confirm the Reduction of Capital. 2 April 2007 - Effective Date of the Scheme and the Reduction of Capital. The Company is required under terms of the Scheme to despatch the consideration within 14 days from the Effective Date". It has a Ferro Alloy Plant near Cuttack, consisting of two 16.5 MVA semi closed electric arc furnace having a capacity of producing around 50,000 tonnes per annum of High Carbon Ferro Chrome. The Board of Rawmet has been reconstituted with nominees of the Company. Its Board now consists of five Directors out of which four are nominees of the Company".

SUBJECT: Acquisition
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that "As part of the Company's focus on regional consolidation, NatSteel Asia Pte. Ltd. (NSA), a wholly owned subsidiary of Tata Steel Limited has entered into an agreement to acquire controlling equity stake in two rolling mills located in Haiphong, Vietnam, subject to certain conditions. The acquisition aggregating to 430,000 tpa finishing capacity will be made in the following two companies: (a) 100% equity holding in a 250,000 tpa bar/wire rod mill in SSE Steel Ltd. and (b) 70% equity holding in Vinausteel Ltd. which produces 180,000 tpa reinforcing bar. (The remaining 30% equity is held by Vietnam Steel Corporation). The enterprise value for the above acquisition is around US $ 41 million, subject to certain closing adjustment on the completion date. This transaction is likely to be completed by June 2007. SSE Steel has one of the most modern rolling mills in Vietnam and the Vinausteel brand is one of the best Known brands in Vietnam for reinforcement bars. The acquisition of these two mills will allow Tata steel to complement, strengthen and expand its current presence in Vietnam. The Company through its subsidiary presently operates a 100,000 tonnes p.a. reinforcing bar / wire rod mill in a joint venture with VSC in Thai Nguyen which is located about 70 Km north of Hanoi. The above acquisition demonstrates Tata Steel's focus on De-integration strategy and will provide the Company with larger footprint in the growing South East Asian Region including Vietnam".

SUBJECT: Outcome of Court Convened Meeting
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that : "At the meeting convened by the Court and held earlier today, 7 March 2007, (the "Court Meeting") and at the subsequent Extraordinary General Meeting the scheme of arrangement (the 'Scheme') to implement the recommended offer for Corus by Tata Steel UK Limited, a wholly-owned indirect subsidiary of the Company at a price of 608 pence per ordinary share in cash (the "Tata Offer") was considered. At both the Court Meeting and the Extraordinary General Meeting, Shareholders approved the Scheme by the requisite majority. Voting Results: The voting results in relation to the Court Meeting and Extraordinary General Meeting are summarised below: (1) Court Meeting - Description: To Approve the Scheme; For Votes - 226783105 (97.43%); Against Votes - 5988195 (2.57%) (2) Extraordinary General Meeting - Description: Special Resolution to approve the Scheme, to amend the Articles of Association of the Company, to cancel all the Cancellation Shares and the Corus Deferred Shares, to reduce the share capital of the Company, to increase the authorised capital of the Company and to authorise the allotment of shares; For Votes - 227167597 (97.48%); Against Votes - 5866894 (2.52%); Abstentions - 2252884. In total, 31,985 shareholders holding, in aggregate, 232,771,300 shares attended the Court Meeting in person and shareholders holding, in aggregate, 233,034,491 shares attended the Extraordinary General Meeting in person. The announcement released in London shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements). SUBJECT: Acquisition
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange on January 31, 2007 that "On 20th October 2006, the Company announced a cash offer of 455 pence per share for Corus Group Plc. (Corus), valuing it at GBP 4.3 billion. Further, on 11th December 2006, the Company announced the terms of a revised offer for Corus at 500 pence per share, valuing it at GBP 4.7 billion. On conclusion of the auction process conducted by the UK Takeover Panel today for the acquisition of Corus, the Company has agreed the terms of an increased acquisition (the Revised Acquisition), at a price of 608 pence per share in cash for acquisition of Corus. The terms of the Revised Acquisition value the entire existing issued and to be issued ordinary share capital of Corus at approximately GBP 6.2 billion. The revised offer of the Company is higher by 5 pence than the final offer made by Companhia Siderurgica Nacional (CSN) in the auction. The acquisition is proposed to be effected by means of a scheme of arrangement under Section 425 of (English) Companies Act 1985, subject to, inter alia, High Court of Justice in England and Wales and Corus shareholders' approvals being obtained. This announcement is not intended to and does not constitute, or form part of, or any offer or invitation to purchase any securities or the solicitation of any vote or approval in any jurisdiction." Tata Steel and NYK will each hold 50% stake in the joint venture company. SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that on November 22, 2006, Tata Steel signed the Joint Venture Agreement with Tata Power Co. Ltd., to set up captive power plants in Chattisgarh, Orissa and Jharkhand. This joint venture aims to meet the power and steam requirements to support the expansion plans of the Company in the above states. The Company will hold 26% equity in the ventures with Tata Power holding 74% equity. Under this agreement, the Company will consume power generated from these power plants meeting the requirements of captive plant norms stipulated by the Government of India's Captive Power Plant Policy. As part of this initiative, Tata Power will initially set up a 120 MW captive power plant for Tata Steel in Jamshedpur, based on utilizing the waste gases from the steel making process.

SUBJECT: Acquisition
DETAILS: Tate Steel has identified a number of specific benefits that it sees from a combination with Corus. Enhanced scale will position the combined group as the fifth largest steel company in the world by production, with a meaningful presence in both Europe and Asia. The powerful combination of low cost upstream production in India with the high end downstream processing facilities of Corus will improve the competitiveness of the European operations of Corus significantly, The combination will also allow the cross-fertilisation of research and development capabilities in the automotive, packaging and construction sectors and there will be a transfer, from Europe to India of technology, best practices and expertise of senior Corus management. In addition, Tata Steel will retain access to low cost raw materials and slab for the enlarged group and exposure to high growth in emerging markets, whilst gaining price stability in developed markets. Tata Steel also believes that between the two companies, there exists a high degree of cultural compatibility which would facilitate an effective integration of the businesses over time. Tata Steel expects to lead the enlarged group with a combined management team. Manufacturing will be organized so as to produce slabs/primary steel in low-cost facilities and produce high-end products in proximity to client base-both Europe and India. Position high-end production in proximity to the client base-in both Europe and India. Further, the company has informed that this announcement is not intended to and does not constitute, or form part of any offer or invitation to purchase any securities or the solicitation of any vote or approval in any jurisdiction. A detailed announcement released in London shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements). For more details click here.

SUBJECT: Acquisition
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors at the Companay  at its meeting held on October 20, 2006, has approved acquisition of the entire issued share capital of Corus Group plc ("Corus") ("Acquisition"), at a price of 455 pence in cash for each share valuing Corus at GBP 4.3 billion. Corus is Europe's second largest steel producer with revenues in 2005 of GBP 9.2  billion, and crude steel production of 18.2 million tons primarily in U.K. and Netherlands. Corus is primarily engaged in the manufacture of semi-finished and finished carbon steel products. Its activities are divided in to three main divisions: strip products (including coated and uncoated strip and welded tubes, sold both as coil and sheet), long products (including sections, plates, wire rod, narrow strip and engineering steels) and the distribution and building systems division, which operates as a link between corus's manufacturing operation and its customers. It has a global network of sales offices and service centres. The Acquisition is proposed to be made by Tata Steel U.K. a wholly-owned indirect subsidiary of Tate Steel, recently incorporated  in the United Kingdom for the purpose of completing the Acquisition. The said Acquisition is proposed to be effected by means of a scheme of arrangement under Section 425 of the (English) Companies Act 1985 subject to High Court of Justice in England and Wales and Corus' shareholders approvals being obtained. Acquisition is proposed to be funded through its own cash resources and loans raised by Tata Steel and its subsidiary companies formed for the purpose of this acquisition. The Acquisition of Corus by Tata Steel is consistent with Tate Steel's stated objective of growth and globalization. Growth at Tata Steel has been focused towards new, higher end-markets and a more sophisticated customer base.

SUBJECT: Raising of Funds
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the shareholders of the Company at the AGM of the Company held on July 05, 2006, have approved raising of the long term funds upto Rs.6,500 crores in one or more tranches, in the form of such instruments as the Board of Directors may approve. Subsequently, as part of the fund raising, the Board of Directors at their meeting held on July 05, 2006 have approved the proposal to offer on a preferential basis, the following securities to its main promoter, namely Tata Sons Limited in accordance with the provisions of Chapter XIII of the SEBI (Disclosure and Investor Protection) Guidelines, 2000. (A) 2,70,00,000 Ordinary Shares of Rs.10 each at a price of Rs.516 per share (which is as per the SEBI's pricing formula) involving an amount of Rs.1393.20 crores. (B) 2,85,00,000 Warrants, where each Warrant would entitle Tata Sons Limited to subscribe to one Ordinary Share of the Company against payment in cash. Tata Sons would be entitle to exercise the option after April 1, 2007 but not later than 18 months from the date of issue of the Warrants. As per SEBI DIP Guidelines, 2000, an amount equivalent to 10% of the price fixed as above i.e. Rs.51.60 per Warrant would be paid by Tata Sons Limited on allotment of the Warrants. The price at which the Warrants will be exercised will be determined in accordance with the SEBI prescribed pricing formula applicable at that time. The proposed allotments will be within the 5% annual limits prescribed by SEBI for preferential allotment/creeping acquisitions. The allotment of Preferential Shares and Warrants will be completed within the prescribed period.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that at the Board Meeting held on May 18,2006, it is proposed to explore ways of raising long term finance for the Company's growth plans for an amount of up to US $ 1 billion in the foreign markets in some appropriate form. This is in accordance with the approval given earlier by the shareholders. Further, the Board has formed a Committee of the Board to examine various options for raising funds and to determine the appropriate form of the securities to be issued, provided the terms prevailing in the market are acceptable.

SUBJECT: Book Closure
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange regarding the closure of the Register of Members from May 30, 2006 to June 19, 2006 (both days inclusive) for the purpose of Annual General Meeting and payment of dividend for the year ended March 31, 2006.

SUBJECT: Investment
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that pursuant to the Definitive Agreement, the Company has acquired 67.11% of equity stake in Millennium Steel Public Company Limited Thailand.  The investment was completed through a combination of preferential allotment of 24.99% equity shares to Tata Steel and 42.12% of equity shares through open tender offer.  The investment was made by the Company and its wholly owned subsidiary,  Natsteel Asia Pte Ltd, Singapore.  On conclusion of the above transaction, the Board of Millennium Steel was reconstituted with the majority of Directors being the nominees of Tata steel. Its Board comprises of 11 Directors of which 6 are the nominees of Tata Steel. Mr B Muthuraman Managing Director, Tata Steel has been appointed as the Chairman of Millennium Steel.  Other members of the Board are Dr. T. Mukherjee, Mr. U. K. Chaturvedi, Mr. Koushik Chatterjee and Mr. Oo Soon Hee. Mr. Santi Charnkolrawee, the present Managing Director of Millennium Steel would continue on the Board as a nominee of Tata Steel. Millennium Steel is one of the largest steel company in Thailand with a capacity of 1.7 mtpa, producing long products for construction and engineering steel for auto industry. It operates through 3 facilities in Thailand.

SUBJECT: Disc under Reg Subs Acq &Takeover & SEBI Insider Trading Reg
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that Janus Investment Fund has acquired 9,72,115 shares aggregating to 0.18% of the total paid up capital of Tata Steel Limited on March 27, 2006. The mode of acquisition is Market Purchase and the shareholding of Janus Investment Fund after the said acquisition is 28,636,879 shares aggregating to 5.17% of the total paid up capital of Tata Steel Limited.

SUBJECT: Change in Nominee Director
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that at the Board Meeting held on March 23, 2006, Mr. Keshub Mahindra and Mr. B. Jitender (nominee director of IDBI) have stepped down from the Board of Tata Steel Limited.

SUBJECT: Agreement
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that on March 13, 2006, Tata steel signed two external commercial borrowing agreements aggregating to Euro 61.42 Million (USD 73.36 Million) at Frankfurt. The above funding would be utilized to finance the import component of "Blast Furnace H" and "Sinter Plant 4" as part of the ongoing expansion project in Jamshedpur. "Blast Furnace H", which will produce 2.5 million tones per annum of hot metal, has been contracted to Paul Wurth Italia and Larsen & Toubro for commissioning. "Sinter Plant 4" of 2.3 million tones per annum capacity is contracted to Outokompu Technology GmbH, Germany and Larsen & Toubro. The ECA covered facilities were signed with Deutsche Bank Aktiengesellschaft, Frankfurt am Main as Original Lender. These facilities are insured by SACE S.p.A. (Servizi Assicurativi per il Commercio Estero ) of Italy and Euler HERMES Kreditversicherungs-Aktiengesellschaft of Germany. The loans have a repayment period of 10 years and an availability period of approximately three and two years respectively. The coupon on the loans will be Euribor plus 12 basis points. In the Financial Year 2005-06, Tata Steel has completed USD 971 Million of External Commercial Borrowings comprising of an IFC (& IFC Syndicated) Loan of USD 400 Million; a Sundicated Loan of USD 500 Million and the above ECA insured financing.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that on March 07, 2006, Tata Steel signed an external commercial borrowing agreement of US$ 500 million (Japanese Yen equivalent of US$ 495 million and US$ 5 million) at Singapore, for funding its growth projects and acquisitions. The syndicated term loan facility was for US$ 400 million (or its equivalent in JPY) with a Greenshoe Option of further US$ 100 million (or its equivalent in JPY). 17 Banks across various geographies participated in the aforesaid syndicated term loan facility. The issue was oversubscribed and the Company exercised the Greenshoe Option. The loan has a door-to-door maturity of 7 years. The coupon of the loan will be Libor plus 45 basis points.

SUBJECT: Disc under Reg Subs Acq &Takeover & SEBI Insider Trading Reg
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that HSBC Global Investment Funds - A/C, HSBC Global Investment Funds (Mauritius) Limited alongwith PAC HSBC Halbis Partners (Hong Kong) Limited has acquired 145,000 shares aggregating to 0.026% of the total paid up capital of Tata Steel Limited on January 17, 2006. The mode of acquisition is Market Purchase and the shareholding of HSBC Global Investment Funds - A/C, HSBC Global Investment Funds (Mauritius) Limited alongwith PAC HSBC Halbis Partners (Hong Kong) Limited after the said acquisition is 27,795,000 shares aggregating to 5.02% of the total paid up capital of Tata Steel Limited.

SUBJECT: Disc under Reg Subs Acq &Takeover & SEBI Insider Trading Reg
DETAILS: HSBC Halbis Partners (Hong Kong) Limited has informed the Exchange that HSBC Global Investment Funds - A/C, HSBC Global Investment Funds (Mauritius) Limited alongwith PAC HSBC Halbis Partners (Hong Kong) Limited has acquired 145,000 shares of the total paid up capital of Tata Steel Limited on January 17, 2006. The mode of acquisition is Market Purchase and the shareholding of HSBC Global Investment Funds - A/C, HSBC Global Investment Funds (Mauritius) Limited alongwith PAC HSBC Halbis Partners (Hong Kong) Limited after the said acquisition is 27,795,000 shares aggregating to 5.02% of the total paid up capital of Tata Steel Limited.

SUBJECT: Acquisition
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the Company on December 15, 2005 signed an agreement with Cementhai Holding Company, a Siam Cement Group Company, Thailand to acquire approximately 40% of Cementhai holding in Milliennium Steel, Thailand and to purchase an additional 24.9% by fresh issue of equity shares subject to shareholders approval. The Company will also undertake to proceed with an open offer subject to certain conditions precedent to be satisfied to Tata Steel requirements. 100% equity value of Millennium Steel Company as ascertained for the transaction is approximately US$ 175 million. Millennium Steel is one of the largest steel Company in Thailand, with a capacity of 1.7 mtpa, producing long products for construction and engineering steel for auto industry. It has three operating facilities in Saraburi, Rayong and Chonburi Province. For the year ended December 31, 2004, Millennium Steel recorded consolidated turnover of US$ 406 million and a net profit of US$ 29 million. The above transaction is subject to all regulatory approvals in Thailand and India as well as shareholders approval of Millennium Steel.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited had informed the Exchange that Tata Steel and BlueScope Steel have agreed to form a 50:50 Joint Venture Company in India. The Company has now informed the Exchange that the Company have on November 23, 2005 signed the Share Subscription Agreement and the Joint Venture Agreement with BlueScope Steel Limited, Australia, to form a 50:50 Joint Venture Company in India to manufacture zinc/aluminum metallic coated steel, painted metallic coated steel and rollformed steel products and deliver pre-engineered buildings and other building solutions. The Joint Venture will construct a new, state-of-the-art metallic coating and painting facility at Jamshedpur in Eastern India, adjacent to Tata Steel's existing steelworks. The new facility will have a metallic coating capacity of 250,000 tonnes and with a paint line capacity of 150,000 tonnes annually. The Joint Venture Company will invest capital cost of Rs.1,200 crores on four manufacturing locations in India and a network of sales offices across SAARC.

SUBJECT: Joint Venture
DETAILS: Tata Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that Tata Steel and BlueScope Steel have agreed to form a 50:50 Joint Venture Company in India. The joint venture company will build the business across India and South Asia that will manufacture zinc/aluminium metallic coated steel, painted metallic coated steel and rollformed steel products, and deliver pre-engineered buildings (PEB) and other building solutions. The Joint Venture Agreement will be officially signed at a ceremony later this month. The joint venture company will construct a major new, state-of-the-art metallic coating and painting facility at Jamshedpur. The new facility will have a metallic coating capacity of 250,000 tonnes and paint line capacity of 150,000 tonnes annually. The capital cost of the project will be approximately Rs. 900 crores. The investment is consistent with the Company's strategy of growing its downstream value-added products business. The joint venture company will assume ownership and responsibility for the development of the three rollforming and PEB manufacturing facilities which BlueScope Steel has under construction at Pune, Chennai and New Delhi. The joint venture will offer a comprehensive range of branded steel products for building and construction applications, including the premium ZINCALUMEﾮ and COLORBONDﾮ coated steel, LYSAGHTﾮ rollformed steel products and BUTLER PEBs. BlueScope Steel is the leading steel producer in Australia and New Zealand, supplying the majority of the flat steel products.

SUBJECT: Name Change/Symbol Change
DETAILS: Members of the Exchange are hereby informed that the name of Tata Iron and Steel Co. Ltd. shall be changed to Tata Steel Limited and the trading symbol of the company be changed from TISCO to TATASTEEL w.e.f. October 17, 2005.

SUBJECT: Memorandum of Understanding
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the Government of Jharkhand and Tata Steel Limited on September 08, 2005, signed Memorandums of Understanding (MOUs) in respect of the setting up of new greenfield steel capacity and enhancement of capacity of Jamshedpur Works as under: (1) Setting up of a 12-million tonnes per annum greenfield integrated steel plant in Manoharpur and Chandil areas of Jharkhand with an estimated investment of Rs.42,000 crores. (2) Expansion of Tata Steel's existing plant at Jamshedpur from 5 million tones per annum to 10 million tonnes per annum with an estimated investment of Rs.11,000 crores. (3) Co-operation in the area of Human Resource Development thru Polytechnic. (4) Co-operation in the area of Human Resource Development thru Industrial Training Institute (ITI). The greenfield integrated steel plant of 12 mtpa will be set up in two phases. The project will also include the development of iron ore mines and other raw material sources including coal and logistic linkages for this plant. The expansion of Jamshedpur works from the present 5 mtpa to 10 mtpa will also be undertaken in two phases.  The Government of Jharkhand and Tata Steel have also entered into two separate MOUs to cooperate in the field of Human Resource Development with an objective to impart technical and job oriented training to the youth of the State through upgradation of polytechnics and Industrial Training Institutes with the help of expert assistance.

SUBJECT: Minutes of AGM
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has submitted to the Exchange a copy of Minutes of AGM of the Company held on July 27, 2005. The details of the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Signing of agreement
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the State Government of Jharkhand has renewed the Jamshedpur Land Lease Agreement for a period of 30 years w.e.f. January 01, 1996 on the same terms and conditions contained in the earlier lease document.  The company has further informed that an agreement was also signed between Tata Steel and Government of Jharkhand to launch the State's unique Health Insurance Scheme for those living Below the Poverty Line (BPL). The initiative will address the critical issue of the health of the poorest of the poor in the State. The scheme will be effective for a period of thirty years and the Company will contribute Rs.25 crores annually during the duration of the scheme. Further details of the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Change of name of the Company
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the name of the Company has been changed from "The Tata Iron and Steel Company Limited" to "Tata Steel Limited".

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that as a part of the next phase of expansion at Jamshedpur, Tata Steel has placed order for a new 2.5 mtpa Blast Furnace on a consortium of Paul Worth-Italia, Paul Wurth-India and L&T. This is the second major order in this phase of expansion. Earlier, it had placed order for the 2 mtpa sinter plant on M/s. Outokumpu and L&T. In line with its plan of increasing production and sales this year, Tata Steel has produced 4.13 lakh tones of saleable steel during July 2005, 18% higher than that of July last year. The spurt in production, seen in July, is expected to continue as the major facilities planned for the one million tonne expansion programme have been commissioned.

SUBJECT: Change of name of the Company
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the shareholders of the Company at the AGM held on July 27, 2005, have approved the proposal to change the name of the Company from 'The Tata Iron and Steel Company Limited' to 'Tata Steel Limited'. Pursuant to this, the Company have filed the necessary application with the Registrar of Companies for a fresh Certificate of Incorporation in the new name.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the Company has on July 18, 2005, signed an agreement with AMCI Australia Pty. Ltd. to buy a 5% interest in the Carborough Downs Coal Project located in Queensland, Australia. The company also signed an offtake agreement for a proportion of the production over life of the project. Carborough Downs is an undeveloped underground coking coal project with production scheduled to commence in year 2006. It is located in Bowen Basin in Central Queensland. The project life is estimated to be of 14 years and approximately 58 million tones of raw coal is expected to be mined during this period. There is a further potential resource of 100 million tones of raw coal in the unexplored areas and deeper seams. The clean coal envisaged to be produced will be low-ash coking coal, highly suitable for steel making. The Carborough Downs coal project is majority owned and operated by AMCI Australia Pty. Ltd., a subsidiary of AMCI Holdings Australia Pty. Ltd. AMCI International AG, the apex holding company of AMCI Holdings Australia Pty. Ltd., is a large global producer, shipper and trader of high-grade metallurgical coal.

SUBJECT: Notice
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange regarding Notice proposed to be published by the company in accordance with section 257(1A) of the Companies Act, 1956 regarding letter dated June 11, 2005 received from Mr. I C Agarwal, a shareholder of the Company proposing himself for the office of Director of the Company at the forthcoming AGM of the Company to be held on July 27, 2005.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the Company has on June 10, 2005, signed a Loan Agreement with International Finance Corporation (IFC) for availing loan of US $ 300 million. IFC is the private sector arm of the World Bank Group. The Company has further informed that under the agreement, IFC will provide Tata Steel with a corporate loan of US $ 300 million, which consists of an A-loan of US $ 100 million directly and a syndicated B-loan of US $ 200 million. The B-loan will be underwritten by Bank of America, N.A., Calyon, The Hongkong & Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited and Standard Chartered Bank. The IFC funding is an important part of Tata Steel's financing strategy. The IFC loan will help the Company to finance its future projects by way of long term funding.

SUBJECT: Signing of agreement
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that Tata Steel signed Joint Venture Agreements on June 12, 2005 with Iranian Mines and Mining Industries Development and Renovation Organizaton (IMIDRO) to join them in their proposed steel making projects and mining operations in Iran . Mr. M Moazenzadeh, Chairman of IMIDRO and Mr. B Muthuraman, Managing Director of Tata Steel signed the agreements in Tehran. Tata Steel would partner them in establishing a 1.5 mtpa (million tones per annum) steel slab making facility, a 1.5 mtpa of steel billet making capacity, a seperate 3 mtpa  export oriented steel plant and in exploraton & mining of unexplored iron ore mines. Tata Steel would partner  IMIDRO in the ongoing Hormozgan Steel project, which would establish  steel -making operations in the Persian Gulf Special Economic Zone (PGSEZ) at the port city of Bandar Abbas. The first phase of this gas based steel project would establish a 1.5 mtpa steel slab making facility, which would be followed by the second phase to establish 1.5 mtpa of steel billet making capacity. In a separate venture, Tata Steel would partner with IMIDRO in exploration and mining of unexplored iron ore mines at the Gol-e-Gohar mines in Kerman province of Iran and would establish a gas based pellet plant at Gol-e-Gohar using this iron ore. IMIDRO and Tata Steel also signed Memorandum Of Understanding expressing  Tata Steel's intent to establish a separate 3-mtpa export oriented  steel plant in two modules of 1.5 mtpa each at PGSEZ in Bandar Abbas in the vicinity of the Hormozgan steel plant.

SUBJECT: Memorandum of Understanding
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the Company signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on June 04, 2005 at Raipur, for setting up a 5 million tonnes per annum greenfield integrated steel plant in the Bastar region of Chhattisgarh. The MoU was signed by Mr. Shivraj Singh, Principal Secretary (Industries and Mineral Resources Department) on behalf of Government of Chhattisgarh and by Mr. B. Muthuraman, Managing Director, Tata Steel, in the presence of the Chief Minister of Chhattisgarh, Dr. Raman Singh and other Government dignitaries. According to the MoU, the integrated steel palnt will have an ultimate capacity of 5 million tonnes per annum of steel with 2 million tonnes per annum in first phase. The first phase of the steel plant is likely to be setup within 48 months to 60 months from the date of obtaining all statutory clearances. The project also includes development of captive iron ore mines to meet the iron ore requirements of this plant. The project is expected to generate employment, both direct and indirect, for large number of people.

SUBJECT: Dividend
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that at the board meeting held on May 19,2005 the directors of the company have decided to recommend to the AGM the payment of Rs.13/- per share as dividend to the shareholders for the year ended March 31,2005.

SUBJECT: Book Closure
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the register of members will remain closed from June 09,2005 to June 29,2005(both days inclusive) for the purpose of  payment of dividend for the year ended March 31,2005, when sanctioned.

SUBJECT: Change of name of the Company
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the BODs of the company at its meeting held on May 19,2005 has approved the change in name of the company to "Tata Steel Limited" subject to the approval of the Registrar of Companies, Maharashtra, Mumbai and the shareholders of the Company. The company has further informed that an item to this effect has been included in the notice of the forthcoming AGM to be held on July 27,2005.

SUBJECT: Minutes of EGM
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has submitted the minutes of the EGM of the Company held on March 24, 2005. The details of the minutes shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that three Tata Group companies including Tata Steel submitted a status update on April 20,2005 to the Board of Investment, Bangladesh, as envisaged in the Expression of Interest signed on October 13, 2004. Tata Steel intends to set up a 2.4 Mtpa steel plant, based on the economic and financial viability of the project. The Tata Group including Tata Steel is in discussions with the Government of Bangladesh on the above project.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. had informed the Exchange regarding the shut down of 'G' Blast Furnace of the company at Jamshedpur.The company has now informed that the Company's largest blast furnace, 'G' has been blown in at 12.30 a.m. on  April 07, 2005. The G-Furnace, which had been shut down on December 03, 2004 for upgradation, had an initial capacity of one million tonnes per annum and a planned campaign life of 10 years. This furnace was blown out after producing a record 14 million tonnes in its first campaign of 12 years. The company has further informed that the upgraded furnace is designed to have a capacity of 1.80 mtpa, and a planned campaign life of 15 years. The furnace was upgraded at a cost of Rs. 580 crores, with the help from SMS-Demag, Germany and it is expected to produce better quality hot metal, at a lower fuel rate in the future. With this furnace in operation, the hot metal capacity of the Company would go up to 5.2 million tonnes in 2005-06, compared to a production of 4.35 million tonnes in 2004-05.

SUBJECT: Credit Rating
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the International Credit Rating Agency Standard & Poor's (S&P) have on March 24, 2005 assigned Tata Steel 'BBB' Local Currency (Corporate) Rating and 'BB +' Foreign Currency Rating with stable outlook.

SUBJECT: Press Release
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the International Credit Rating Agency Moody's Investor Services (Moody's) have assigned Tata Steel Senior Implied (Corporate) Rating of Baa2 with stable outlook.  The Baa2 fundamental rating for Tata Steel is one notch above Moody's current sovereign rating for India of Baa3.  The details of the press release issued by the company regarding the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Notice of EGM
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that an EGM of the company will be held on March 24, 2005. The details of the notice of EGM shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the Company had entered into Definitive Share Subscription Agreement on August 16, 2004 to acquire 100% of the Steel Business of NatSteel Ltd. including the Singapore operations, investments in Thailand, China, Malaysia, Vietnam, Philippines and Australia. The company has completed the above transaction whereby the Company has subscribed to 100% equity of NatSteel Asia Pte Ltd. As part of the transaction, all steel assets of NatSteel Limited in Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Vietnam, Philippines, Australia and China (except Changzhou Wujin NatSteel) have been transferred to NatSteel Asia Pte Limited.  Amongst the China Investments the regulatory approvals for the transfer of Southern NatSteel (Xiamen) Co. Ltd. and Wuxi Jingyang Metal Products Co. Ltd. have been received and transferred to NatSteel Asia Pte Ltd. The transfer of Changzhou Wujin NatSteel Co. Ltd. to Natsteel Asia Pte Limited is delayed as the regulatory approval for Changzhou Wujin NatSteel Co. Ltd. is pending with the relevant authorities in China. Consequently, the Company has held back S$ 60 million from the purchase consideration for the above purpose. The Company has signed a Supplemental Subscription Agreement with NatSteel Ltd. on February 15, 2005 for the above purpose.  As per the Share Subscription Agreement signed on August 16, 2004, the Negotiated Enterprise Value was S$ 486.4 million and on completion Tata Steel was required to pay S$ 364.8 million (Initial Payment). The balance payment is subject to adjustment for Net Working Capital and other adjustments as will be determined by the Closing Audit. Pursuant to the Supplemental Subscription Agreement, the Company has held back S$ 60 million from the Initial Payment that would be released on successful transfer of Changzhou Wujin NatSteel Co. Ltd to NatSteel Asia Pte Ltd which is expected to be completed before the end of April 2005.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: The Board of NatSteel Asia Pte Limited has been reconstituted to induct Mr. B Muthuraman, Managing Director - Tata Steel as the Chairman and Mr. Oo Soon Hee as the Managing Director. The other members inducted to the Board are Dr. T Mukherjee, Dy M D (Steel), Tata Steel and Mr. Koushik Chatterjee, Vice President (Finance), Tata Steel.

SUBJECT: Extra-Ordinary General Meeting
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the BoD's at its meeting held on January 20, 2005, has approved convening of an Extra Ordinary General Meeting of the shareholders' on March 24, 2005 for obtaining their approval for raising long term resource requirements of upto Rs.5,000 crores for funding the Company's growth projects and such other purposes as may be approved by the Board.

SUBJECT: Raising of funds
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the BODs at its meeting held on January 20, 2005,has approved convening of an EGM of the shareholders on March 24,2005 for obtaining their approval for raising long term resource requirements of upto Rs. 5,000 crores for funding the Company's growth projects and such other purposes as may be approved by the Board.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that on January 12, 2005, in the presence of Tata Group Chairman, Mr. Ratan Tata, the Chief Minister of West Bengal, Shri Budhadeb Bhattacharya and Mr. B Muthuraman, Managing Director of Tata Steel, the Company executed a Shareholders' Agreement in Kolkata with West Bengal Industrial Development Corporation Ltd. (WBIDC), to set up a Merchant Coke Oven Plant at Haldia. The proposed project is being undertaken to manufacture and sale of metallurgical coke in the international and domestic markets. This Plant will also supply coke to the Company's Works at Jamshedpur. The capacity of the coke oven plant will be 0.8 mil.tons of coke per year after Phase I. The Project has also envisaged generation of electric power of 60 MW capacity. During the same ceremony, a long term Power Purchase Agreement was also executed with West Bengal State Electricity Board. The capital cost of the project of around Rs.700 crores is proposed to be funded through a mix of debt & equity from Tata Steel and WBIDC.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the company has on November 17,2004 signed a Memorandum of Understanding(MOU) with the Orissa Government for setting up a six million ton green field Steel Plant at Kalinganagar in Jaipur District of Orissa. According to the MOU,a six million ton Steel Plant will be set up at a total cost of Rs.15,400 crore in two modules of three million tons each. The first module, comprising three million ton steel plant complex having Blast Furnace, Coke Ovens, Sinter Plant, Caster and Rolling Mill will be completed in four years. This will be followed by the second module of three million ton to be set up in twenty four months thereafter. The project also includes development of captive iron ore mines to meet the iron ore requirements of this plant and modern townships for the employees of the Iron Ore Mines and the Steel Plant. The company has also drawn up plans for development of Gopalpur region, where it is in possession of 3200 acre land acquired by it for its earlier proposed Steel Plant. It proposed to set up a technical Training Institute at Goplapur and work with the State Government to help set up a Special Economic Zone(SEZ) on a part of the land. Pre feasibility study for setting up the SEZ has been completed and an SPV is now to be formed between Government of Orissa and the company to progress the matter further. The company also proposes to set up a cold Rolled Steel Processing Centre at Gopalpur, as part of forward integration of its Kalinganagar Steel Plant.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that the Company's Board has approved the signing of definitive agreements for its participation in the joint venture with L&T for the Dharma Port project in Orissa. The Agreements will be signed on October 29, 2004. Tata Steel's growth and globalization plans will leverage a modern deep-water port to bring down the logistics cost and provide greater accessibility to global markets. L&T's vast expertise in infrastructure projects and port construction will ensure the timely and economic completion of the port. The project cost as approved by the Board is around Rs.15 billion and will have a handling capacity of 25 million tones per annum. The project is planned over two phases and is expected to commence operations in Dec'2007. Third party cargo is also envisaged for this port.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that as part of the 1 million tonne per annum crude steel expansion programme at Jamshedpur, the Company has planned to reline and upgrade the capacity of 'G' Blast Furnace from the existing 1.2 million tonne per annum to 1.8 million tonne per annum. The 'G' Blast Furnace was earlier planned to be shut down for around 100 days from mid September 2004. The condition of the Blast Furnace was critically reviewed in the month of July 2004 and certain other steps were taken to prolong its life. These have been successful. Steps have also been taken to see that all other Blast Furnaces can produce full output during the revamping of 'G' Blast Furnace. It has thus been decided to shut down the furnace sometime in early December 2004 for 100 days. There will be no change in the overall production plan on account of the change in the shut down schedule.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Tata Iron And Steel Co. Ltd. has informed the Exchange that that as part of the 1 million tonne per annum crude steel expansion programme at Jamshedpur, the Company has planned to reline and upgrade the capacity of 'G' Blast Furnace from the existing 1.2 million tonne per annum to 1.8 million tonne per annum. The 'G' Blast Furnace was earlier planned to be shut down for around 100 days from mid September 2004. The condition of the Blast Furnace was critically reviewed in the month of July 2004 and certain other steps were taken to prolong its life. These have been successful. Steps have also been taken to see that all other Blast Furnaces can produce full output during the revamping of 'G' Blast Furnace. It has thus been decided to shut down the furnace sometime in early December 2004 for 100 days. There will be no change in the overall production plan for the year on account of the change in the shut down schedule.

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The press had reports on July 22, 2004 that Tata Iron And Steel Co. Limited signed an agreement with SAP India, for marketing and distribution of SAP solutions for the metals and minning industry in the country. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the press and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. Tata Iron And Steel Co. Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "In this connection, we would like to clarify that the Company, a leading user of IT, is an early adopter of SAP and it has implemented SAP in a phased manner to increase coverage of business processes and business units. SAP system has been extended to customers and business partners through the use of internet technologies and B2B integration. The Company plans to become one-stop shop for large metal and mining organisations by providing them SAP business application."
